intro: Mesembryanthemum luteolum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its flowers typically bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mesembryanthemum luteolum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
